Tuntut Kejelasan Status, Ratusan Karyawan RSUD Al Ihsan Melakukan Unjuk Rasa
04 Nov 2019, 03:41 by Sarnapi
SOREANG, (PR).- Ratusan karyawan, dokter dan perawat RSUD Al Ihsan Baleendah menggelar unjuk rasa menuntut kejelasan status kepegawaiannya, Senin, 4 November 2019. Mereka mendesak agar Pemprov Jabar menetapkan direktur hasil dari lelang jabatan dan kejelasan uang pesangon karyawan yang memasuki masa pensiun dan masih tertahan.
Karyawan, dokter dan perawat berunjuk rasa setelah melaksanakan apel rutin tiap pagi. Mereka berkumpul di Gedung A dengan membawa keranda jenazah lengkap dengan tulisan Inna lillaahi wainna ilaihi rajiun yang biasa dibawa mobil jenazah RSUD Al Ihsan.
Menurut Ketua Forum Komunikasi Karyawan RSUD Al Ihsan, Ahmad Husaini, unjuk rasa ini sudah beberapa kali dilakukan para karyawan berkaitan dengan kejelasan status karyawannya. "Setelah Rumah sakit Al Ihsan diserahkan kepada Pemprov Jabar pada tahun 2005 dari Yayasan Al Ihsan sebagai keputusan dari pengadilan. Seharusnya penyerahan aset rumah sakit sekaligus SDM rumah sakit," ucapnya.
Sedangkan Plt Wadir Umum dan Keuangan RSUD Al Ihsan, Agus Muharram menambahkan, nasib para karyawan, dokter dan perawat yang kini jumlahnya mencapai lebih dari 900 orang tidak jelas. "Setelah rumah sakit diambil alih Pemprov Jabar status karyawan adalah Badan Layanan Umum Daerah (BLUD). Tapi aturan hukum soal karyawan BLUD ini tidak jelas sampai sekarang," katanya.
Ketidakjelasan juga menimpa uang pesangon bagi karyawan yang memasuki masa pensiun. "Kasus terakhir menimpa karyawan bagian Humas Sukisna yang memasuki masa pensiun ada April lalu, namun hasil pesangonnya belum ada sama sekali," katanya.
Akibat unjuk rasa ini, pelayanan rumah sakit sempat terganggu. Para karyawan, dokter dan perawat bertahan di halaman dan menolak untuk musyawarah dengan Direktur RSUD Al Ihsan, Ujang Komarudin.***

Demanding Clarity of Status, Hundreds of Employees of Al Ihsan Regional Hospital Conduct Demonstration
Nov 04 2019, 03:41 by Sarnapi
SOREANG, (PR) .- Hundreds of employees, doctors and nurses at Al Ihsan Baleendah Regional Public Hospital held a demonstration demanding clear employment status, Monday, November 4, 2019. They urged the West Java Provincial Government to appoint the director of the results of the job auction and clarity of employee severance pay entering the period of employment. retired and still stuck.
Employees, doctors and nurses rallied after holding a routine apple every morning. They gathered in Building A with the coffin coffin complete with the words Inna lillaahi wainna ilaihi rajiun usually taken by the hearse of Al Ihsan District Hospital.
According to the Chairman of the Al Ihsan Public Hospital Communication Forum, Ahmad Husaini, this demonstration has been carried out several times by employees regarding the clarity of their employee status. "After the Al Ihsan Hospital was handed over to the West Java Provincial Government in 2005 from the Al Ihsan Foundation as a decision from the court, the hospital's assets and human resources should be handed over," he said.
While Acting General and Finance Acting Al Ihsan Hospital, Agus Muharram added, the fate of the employees, doctors and nurses who now number more than 900 people is unclear. "After the hospital was taken over by the West Java Provincial Government the status of the employees was the Regional Public Service Agency (BLUD). But the legal rules regarding BLUD employees are not clear until now," he said.
Lack of clarity also befits severance pay for employees entering retirement. "The last case happened to Sukisna Public Relations employees who entered retirement there last April, but the severance pay did not yet exist at all," he said.
As a result of this demonstration, hospital services were disrupted. Employees, doctors and nurses stayed on the lawn and refused to consult with the Director of the Al Ihsan Hospital, Ujang Komarudin. ***
